Module com.example.sudokuproject
Package com.example.sudokuproject.controller

Class WelcomeSudokuController

java.lang.Object
com.example.sudokuproject.controller.WelcomeSudokuController
public class WelcomeSudokuController extends Object
Controller for the Welcome Sudoku view. This controller handles the animations for the play button and the numbers on the Sudoku grid. It also manages the start of a new Sudoku game.
Author:
Mateo Noguera Pinto

      The model used by the controller to generate random cells and numbers.

  • Constructor Details

    • WelcomeSudokuController

      public WelcomeSudokuController()
      Default constructor for the controller. Initializes the model.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Method automatically called by JavaFX on initialization. It starts the animation for the Sudoku grid and the play button.

    • sudokuAnimation

      public void sudokuAnimation()
      Generates an animation for three random cells on the Sudoku grid. Each cell is assigned a random number between 1 and 6 without repetition. The selected cell displays the number and applies a fade transition.

    • startFadeTransition

      public void startFadeTransition(javafx.scene.control.TextField textField, double duration, double from, double to, double delay)
      Applies a fade transition to a given text field.
      Parameters:
      textField - The text field where the fade transition is applied.
      duration - The duration of the transition in seconds.
      from - The starting opacity value.
      to - The ending opacity value.
      delay - The delay before starting the transition in seconds.

    • startPlayButtonAnimation

      public void startPlayButtonAnimation()
      Starts a scale animation for the play button. The button increases in size slightly, and the animation repeats indefinitely.

    • onPlayPressed

      public void onPlayPressed(javafx.event.Event event) throws IOException
      Handles the event when the play button is pressed. A confirmation alert is displayed, and if confirmed, the current window is closed, and a new Sudoku game is started.
      Parameters:
      event - The event triggered by pressing the play button.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an error occurs while loading the Sudoku game view.
